title: The USB-C charging mandate arrives in the EU — here’s what that means - The Verge
summary:
EU Mandates USB-C Charging for Devices Starting December 28th

Publication Date: December 2023 | Source: The Verge

Photo by Amelia Holowaty Krales / The Verge

The European Union is set to implement a directive mandating the use of USB-C charging ports for most electronic devices starting December 28, 2024. This directive aims to reduce e-waste and standardize charging solutions, improving consumer convenience.

  • The directive encompasses a wide range of devices including smartphones, tablets, and headphones.
  • Companies must ensure products sold in the EU are capable of charging via USB-C or risk being pulled from the market.
  • Regulations will also cover fast charging practices and encourage unbundling chargers from devices, reducing excess waste.
  • Exceptions apply to laptops and certain devices, with phased compliance timelines.
"The sheer breadth of this directive means its impact will be felt by both consumers and businesses."

As the EU enforces this directive, it could lead to significant industry changes, pushing for more sustainable practices and simplified charging solutions across the technology landscape.
newTitle: EU Mandates USB-C Charging for Devices Starting December 28th

YouTube adds 'Play Something' button to help you find your next video - CNBCTV18
summary:
YouTube adds 'Play Something' button to help you find your next video

Publication Date: March 2024 | Source: CNBC TV18

YouTube is testing a new "Play Something" button on its mobile app, aimed at enhancing content discovery and minimizing scrolling.

  • The button is part of the latest Android version 19.50 and has been in development since last year.
  • It directly launches videos in the Shorts player interface but also plays regular videos in portrait mode.
  • The feature resembles Netflix’s “Play Something” and aims to provide a tailored browsing experience.
  • It may significantly influence how users find and watch content on YouTube.
“The 'Play Something' button could mark a significant step in how users discover and consume content on YouTube.”

This new feature could transform the user experience by offering a more personalized way to explore content on YouTube.
newTitle: YouTube Introduces 'Play Something' Button for Easier Video Discovery

summary:

  • Powered by MediaTek Dimensity 7300 SoC with up to 12GB RAM
  • Storage options up to 512GB UFS 3.1

title: Xiaomi 15 Ultra leaks: Flagship smartphone tipped to debut in February 2025 - what to expect | Mint - Mint
summary:
Xiaomi 15 Ultra leaks: Flagship smartphone tipped to debut in February 2025 - what to expect

Publication Date: N/A Source: Live Mint

Tech giant Xiaomi is reportedly gearing up to unveil its highly anticipated Xiaomi 15 Ultra in China by February 2025. According to leaks from Digital Chat Station on Weibo, the flagship smartphone is expected to debut on 28 February 2025.

  • The Xiaomi 15 Ultra will join the Xiaomi 15 series, launched in October, which includes the Xiaomi 15 and Xiaomi 15 Pro.
  • It is rumored to feature Qualcomm’s Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset and a 50MP triple-camera system.
  • Potentially noteworthy is a 200MP telephoto sensor with 4.3x optical zoom.
  • Advanced imaging capabilities, upgraded macro sensor, and larger aperture for enhanced low-light performance are also expected.
  • It will reportedly come with IP68 and IP69 certifications for dust and water resistance and wireless charging capabilities.
  • Similar to its series counterparts, it may ship with Android 15-based HyperOS 2.0 and maintain a 5,000mAh battery.
  • Speculation for an India launch is strong, potentially in March 2025, with expected pricing around ₹99,999 for a model with 16GB RAM and 512GB storage.

Xiaomi has not confirmed these details, but leaks indicate that the Xiaomi 15 Ultra could set a new benchmark in flagship smartphone technology.
newTitle: Xiaomi 15 Ultra leaks: Flagship smartphone tipped to debut in February 2025 - what to expect

title: One UI 7 Update Lets Users Turn Off Annoying ‘Super HDR’ Content on Galaxy Devices: Report - Gadgets 360
summary:
Samsung May Let Users Disable This Annoying Feature With One UI 7

Date: October 2024, Source: Gadgets 360

Samsung announced its Android 15-based update, One UI 7, addressing a long-standing issue with bright HDR content on devices. The update includes a new toggle for the Super HDR feature, allowing users to prevent automatic brightness adjustments.

Key Points:

  • The update brings a new Super HDR toggle in the Settings app.
  • Turning off the toggle stops the device from increasing brightness for HDR content.
  • Currently available for Galaxy S24 users as part of the beta program.
  • The beta is initially accessible in several countries, including Germany and the US.
  • Supports 29 global languages, expanding accessibility for users.

Notable Quotes:

“Automatically adjust the display to show the full range of colors and contrast in pictures taken with Galaxy devices.” - Mishaal Rahman, Android Authority

Samsung's One UI 7 is a significant step forward for user control over HDR content display.
newTitle: Samsung May Let Users Disable This Annoying Feature With One UI 7
